label: A2B_oF24_70_e_a-001
title: TiSi$_{2}$ ($C54$) Nowotony Chimney-Ladder Structure
comments: This is the simplest example of a ``Nowotny chimney-ladder structure'' (Pearson, 1970), T$_{n}$X$_{m}$, where ``T'' is a transition metal, ``X'' is a row III or IV metal (or semiconductor), and $1.25 \le m/n {<} 2$.  The transition metal atoms are arranged similarly to the atoms in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tI4_141_a-001}{$\beta$-Sn ($A5$)}.
